title: Alicia Silverstone Goes to Ireland in 'Irish Blood' Series Official Trailer
description: "I suspect 'you' aren't the only secret he kept..." Acorn TV has revealed an official trailer for a new mystery thriller series titled Irish Blood, arriving to watch on Acorn TV later this summer. There is another series called Blood on Acorn TV, but it's unrelated. Alicia Silverstone (who has British parents) stars as divorce lawyer Fiona Fox who receives a message from her estranged father, embarking on a journey to Ireland. Her path in life is earmarked by her father, Declan, who seemingly abandoned her and her mother on her 10th birthday. In Ireland, she uncovers family truths and her father's dark past, realizing her life's abandonment story was a protective lie. Silverstone also adds: "Irish Blood is the story of a woman discovering herself and confronting her past after traveling abroad unexpectedly. I love how unpredictable the storytelling feels and the combination of drama, humor, and suspense my character experiences." The series also features Wendy Crewson, Jason O'Mara, Dearbhla Molloy, Simone Kirby, Ruth Codd, & Leonardo Taiwo. Shot on location in Ireland (and it looks beautiful there, of course). Worth watching just to explore the island. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Acorn TV's Ireland series [â€¦]
author: Alex Billington

Acorn TV has revealed an official trailer for a new mystery thriller series titled Irish Blood, arriving to watch on Acorn TV later this summer. There is another series called Blood on Acorn TV, but it's unrelated. Alicia Silverstone (who has British parents) stars as divorce lawyer Fiona Fox who receives a message from her estranged father, embarking on a journey to Ireland. Her path in life is earmarked by her father, Declan, who seemingly abandoned her and her mother on her 10th birthday. In Ireland, she uncovers family truths and her father's dark past, realizing her life's abandonment story was a protective lie. Silverstone also adds: "Irish Blood is the story of a woman discovering herself and confronting her past after traveling abroad unexpectedly. I love how unpredictable the storytelling feels and the combination of drama, humor, and suspense my character experiences." The series also features Wendy Crewson, Jason O'Mara, Dearbhla Molloy, Simone Kirby, Ruth Codd, & Leonardo Taiwo. Shot on location in Ireland (and it looks beautiful there, of course). Worth watching just to explore the island. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Acorn TV's Ireland series Irish Blood, direct from YouTube: Divorce lawyer Fiona Sharpe (starring Alicia Silverstone) receives a message from her estranged father, embarking on a journey to Ireland. There she learns key truths about her father as well as a family that doesnâ€™t know she exists, and, moreover, the story of abandonment that has shaped her entire life â€“ was a lie. A lie intended to protect her and her mother from her fatherâ€™s shady business dealings. Fiona resolves to uncover the full truth about her father and reconnect with the parent she only thought she knew... Irish Blood is a streaming series created & co-written by John Krizanc and Christina Ray. With additional writing by Aaron Martin and Mike O'Leary. With episodes directed by Molly McGlynn. Produced by Paige Haight and Catherine McGee. Made by Deadpan Pictures & Shaftesbury for Acorn TV, AMC Networks' international streaming platform. Exec produced by Christina Jennings, Scott Garvie, Paul Donovan, Ailish McElmeel, Aaron Martin, Christina Ray, Alicia Silverstone, Molly McGlynn. Acorn TV will debut the Irish Blood series streaming on Acorn TV (only in the US for now) starting August 11th, 2025 this summer. Want to watch? html:
TRAILERS

by
July 6, 2025
Source: YouTube

"I suspect 'you' aren't the only secret he kept..." Acorn TV has revealed an official trailer for a new mystery thriller series titled Irish Blood, arriving to watch on Acorn TV later this summer. There is another series called Blood on Acorn TV, but it's unrelated. Alicia Silverstone (who has British parents) stars as divorce lawyer Fiona Fox who receives a message from her estranged father, embarking on a journey to Ireland. Her path in life is earmarked by her father, Declan, who seemingly abandoned her and her mother on her 10th birthday. In Ireland, she uncovers family truths and her father's dark past, realizing her life's abandonment story was a protective lie. Silverstone also adds: "Irish Blood is the story of a woman discovering herself and confronting her past after traveling abroad unexpectedly. I love how unpredictable the storytelling feels and the combination of drama, humor, and suspense my character experiences." The series also features Wendy Crewson, Jason O'Mara, Dearbhla Molloy, Simone Kirby, Ruth Codd, & Leonardo Taiwo. Shot on location in Ireland (and it looks beautiful there, of course). Worth watching just to explore the island. ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡ª

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Acorn TV's Ireland series Irish Blood, direct from YouTube:

Divorce lawyer Fiona Sharpe (starring Alicia Silverstone) receives a message from her estranged father, embarking on a journey to Ireland. There she learns key truths about her father as well as a family that doesnâ€™t know she exists, and, moreover, the story of abandonment that has shaped her entire life â€“ was a lie. A lie intended to protect her and her mother from her fatherâ€™s shady business dealings. Fiona resolves to uncover the full truth about her father and reconnect with the parent she only thought she knew... Irish Blood is a streaming series created & co-written by John Krizanc and Christina Ray. With additional writing by Aaron Martin and Mike O'Leary. With episodes directed by Molly McGlynn. Produced by Paige Haight and Catherine McGee. Made by Deadpan Pictures & Shaftesbury for Acorn TV, AMC Networks' international streaming platform. Exec produced by Christina Jennings, Scott Garvie, Paul Donovan, Ailish McElmeel, Aaron Martin, Christina Ray, Alicia Silverstone, Molly McGlynn. Acorn TV will debut the Irish Blood series streaming on Acorn TV (only in the US for now) starting August 11th, 2025 this summer. Want to watch?
